review: I have had the Amazon Fire Stick for a few months now.  Other than having to re-log onto Netflix a few times, no problems. Until now. I recently installed the iheart radio app.  The device automatically registered and activated my device using SOMEONE ELSE'S email address.  I have no idea whose email it was.  Amazon tells me it is not a returned or refurbished model.  I was told that perhaps the email address and account I had access to belonged to somebody I have previously shipped items to.  So, because this person has an existing iheart radio account and I sent them an item, I was able to log on to an app automatically AS THEM.  Seems like a major security/privacy issue that should be handled ASAP.****UPDATE****  Received an email from Amazon customer service it states in part; " I've researched 'iheart radio' and found that it isn't available for the Fire TV Stick at this time.... 'iheart radio' is only available on Amazon Fire TV"  May have been a bot response but it is inaccurate and unhelpful.
author: Patrick
